skill.name: biomni
skill.description: Autonomous biomedical AI agent framework for executing complex research tasks across genomics, drug discovery, molecular biology, and clinical analysis. Use this skill when conducting multi-step biomedical research including CRISPR screening design, single-cell RNA-seq analysis, ADMET prediction, GWAS interpretation, rare disease diagnosis, or lab protocol optimization. Leverages LLM reasoning with code execution and integrated biomedical databases.
skill.summary: Autonomous biomedical AI agent framework for executing complex research tasks across genomics, drug ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate biomedical research framework from Stanford SNAP Lab. The static analyzer flagged 418 potential issues, but the vast majority are false positives: markdown backticks misinterpreted as shell execution, SMILES chemical notation flagged as C2/crypto keywords, and legitimate API key configuration patterns. The skill's core functionality (LLM-generated code execution with API credential access) triggers heuristic alerts but is documented, intended behavior for a research tool. SKILL.md explicitly warns users about running in isolated environments and reviewing generated code.

medium_findings.title: LLM-generated code execution with full system privileges
medium_findings.description: The agent executes LLM-generated Python code with full system privileges. This is documented functionality for biomedical analysis but represents elevated risk. SKILL.md lines 228-233 explicitly warn users and recommend running in isolated environments (Docker, VMs).

low_findings.title: Subprocess execution for conda environment setup
low_findings.description: Setup script uses subprocess.run for conda commands. Commands are hardcoded with no user input in construction. Standard practice for environment management.

low_findings.title: API keys stored in .env file without .gitignore verification
low_findings.description: The setup script saves API keys to .env but does not verify the file is in .gitignore. Users should manually ensure .env is gitignored.

content.user_title: Run autonomous biomedical research with AI
content.value_statement: Complex biomedical research tasks require specialized knowledge and repetitive analysis steps. Biomni automates multi-step research workflows across genomics, drug discovery, and clinical genomics using LLM-powered reasoning and integrated biomedical databases.
actual_capabilities: Design CRISPR screens with sgRNA library generation and gene prioritization
Analyze single-cell RNA-seq data including cell type annotation and clustering
Predict ADMET properties for drug candidates using integrated databases
Interpret GWAS results with variant-to-gene mapping and pathway enrichment
Diagnose rare diseases from exome sequencing using HPO phenotype matching
Generate analysis code automatically and execute pipelines autonomously
limitations: Requires API keys for LLM providers (Anthropic recommended)
Data lake (~11GB) must be downloaded on first use
Does not perform laboratory experiments directly
Generated code should be reviewed before execution on sensitive data

use_cases.title: Genomics research automation
use_cases.description: Automate GWAS interpretation, pathway analysis, and variant pathogenicity prediction for publications

use_cases.title: ADMET prediction pipeline
use_cases.description: Screen drug candidates for absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion, and toxicity properties

use_cases.title: Rare disease diagnosis
use_cases.description: Analyze WES data and phenotype terms to identify candidate variants and support diagnostic reports

prompt_templates.title: Gene function query
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the main functions of the {gene_name} gene? Include molecular function, associated diseases, and protein interactions.

prompt_templates.title: CRISPR screen design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a CRISPR knockout screen for {phenotype} in {cell_type}. Include sgRNA library design, gene prioritization criteria, and expected hit genes.

prompt_templates.title: scRNA-seq analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this single-cell RNA-seq dataset at {file_path}. Perform quality control, clustering, cell type annotation using marker genes, and differential expression analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-omics integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Integrate multi-omics data for {disease}: GWAS variants, brain RNA-seq expression, and proteomics. Identify causal genes, pathway enrichment, and therapeutic targets.

output_examples.input: Design a CRISPR screen to identify genes regulating autophagy in HEK293 cells
output: sgRNA library: ~80,000 guides targeting 20,000 protein-coding genes
4 sgRNAs per gene with optimal on-target scores (Doench 2016 metric)
Priority genes: ATG5, BECN1, ULK1 as positive controls
Pathway enrichment highlights autophagy core machinery
Generated Python code for library design and quality metrics

output_examples.input: Analyze single-cell RNA-seq data from a COVID-19 patient bronchoalveolar lavage sample
output: 8 major cell populations identified via clustering
Novel pneumocyte subset with interferon signature
Generated scanpy pipeline with UMAP visualizations

output_examples.input: Predict ADMET properties for this drug candidate: CC1=CC=C(C=C1)NC(=O)C2=CC=C(C=C2)CN3CCN(CC3)C
output: CYP3A4 substrate: Yes, CYP2D6 inhibitor: Weak
hepatotoxicity: Low risk based on structural alerts

best_practices: Provide specific biological context including organism, cell type, and experimental conditions
Include file paths and data formats for analysis tasks
Set clear thresholds for statistical significance and fold change cutoffs
Run in isolated environments (Docker, VMs) when processing sensitive patient data
anti_patterns: Asking vague questions without specifying organism, tissue, or experimental design
Skipping review of generated code before execution on valuable datasets
Running without timeout limits on complex multi-step analyses
Using production credentials in shared or public environments

faq.question: Which LLM provider works best with Biomni?
faq.answer: Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4 offers the best balance of reasoning quality and speed for biomedical tasks.

faq.question: How much disk space does Biomni require?
faq.answer: The integrated biomedical databases require approximately 11GB. Data downloads automatically on first use.

faq.question: Can Biomni integrate with existing bioinformatics tools?
faq.answer: Yes, Biomni generates and executes Python code using standard libraries like scanpy, pandas, and scipy.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using Biomni?
faq.answer: Biomni processes data locally and only sends queries to LLM APIs. Use isolated environments for sensitive data.

faq.question: Why did my task time out?
faq.answer: Complex analyses may exceed default timeout. Increase default_config.timeout_seconds in the config.

faq.question: How does Biomni compare to other biomedical LLMs?
faq.answer: Biomni combines LLM reasoning with code execution and integrated databases for autonomous multi-step analysis.
